alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 26 at 4:31PM EST until February 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. For the Cumberland River...including Barbourville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Saturday the stage was 26.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is falling, but will continue to run high through Sunday morning. - Action stage is 21.5 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 11 PM.
